description: loc is primarily label-based, not integer-position-based
quote: .loc[] is primarily label based, but may also be used with a boolean array.

description: Integer inputs to loc are interpreted as labels, never as integer positions
quote: 5 is interpreted as a label of the index, and never as an integer position along the index

description: Label slices include both start and stop endpoints (contrary to usual Python slices)
quote: Note that contrary to usual python slices, both the start and the stop are included

description: Single label row access returns a Series, not a DataFrame
quote: Single label, e.g. 5 or 'a', (note that 5 is interpreted as a label of the index, and never as an integer position along the index).

description: A list or array of labels returns a DataFrame
quote: A list or array of labels, e.g. ['a', 'b', 'c'].

description: KeyError raised when any requested label is not found
quote: Raises KeyError: If any items are not found.

description: Boolean array selects rows where the value is True; NA values treated as False
quote: A boolean array (any NA values will be treated as False).

description: Callable key is called with the DataFrame/Series and its return value is used for indexing
quote: A callable, e.g. a function with one argument (the calling Series or DataFrame) that returns valid output for indexing (one of the above).

description: IndexingError raised when an indexed key's index is unalignable to the frame index
quote: Raises IndexingError: If an indexed key is passed and its index is unalignable to the frame index.
